query: What is a course director?
answer: (A course director is the equivalent of the Learning Activity Owner in LMS)|(A course director in Moodle is registered in Moodle as the owner of the course.)

query: What is a Main Learning Designer?
answer: (A Main Learning Designer has write access to redesign course or create a course from scratch)|(Access for a Main Learning Designer can be set at site level or portfolio level or course level)|(Co-designer\(s\) can be assigned to a project via the Main Designer to support the creation of a course)

query: What is the Main Learning Facilitator?
answer: (A Main Learning Facilitator has limited write access to certain course content)|(A Main Learning Facilitator is the overall facilitator of a course)

query: What is the Event Facilitator?
answer: An Event Facilitator in Moodle is generally a Learning Event Manager that requires access to do minor edits on course dates, news updates and some logistical aspects

query: What is the Guest Learning Facilitator?
answer: (A Guest Learning Facilitator is a supporting facilitator responsible for certain parts/topics of an event or course)|(A Guest Learning Facilitator has no write access to a course)

query: What is the Test Participant?
answer: A Test Participant is a Functional user, that is used to test the proper setup of a course from a learner.s perspective

query: What is a Guest?
answer: (A Guest user has no write access to the course at all)|(A Guest can only view content that is open to guests)|(This is a special role to give limited access to specific courses for communication purposes)

query: What is a Participant?
answer: (A Participant is a learner of a course)|(In Moodle, a Participant (can not)|(can't) alter the content of the course and only take part in accessing the content and activities)

query: What is the Moodle Admin?
answer: The Moodle Admin is required to manage Moodle from a technical perspective.

query: How do I change my Password?
answer: If yourÂ account is managed in Moodle, it offers the possibility to send you a new password through requesting it

query: Why is Moodle asking me to change my Password?
answer: Due to Information Risk Management \(IRM\) requirements, Moodle users will need to change their password on a monthly basis

query: Do users external to Shell get the email with their username and password to access Moodle?
answer: Moodle sends an email to new external users with their Moodle account details, upon course registration

query: How do I update my user profile?
answer: The user profile can be changed through the Moodle interface

query: How can I assign roles in my course?
answer: (By default, Main Learning Facilitators can only assign the roles of Guest Learning Facilitator and Guest)|(Main Learning Designers can only assign the roles of Co-Designer, Main Learning Facilitator, Guest Learning Facilitator and Guest)|(Only Course Owners can assign the role of Event Facilitators)

query: Why are there so many non-SOU-registered participants in my course?
answer: (Learning Professionals may receive access to more than just for a single course)|(Some of the people that are showing on the course participant list of have general access to a few courses)

query: How can I cancel or remove participants from a course?
answer: Participants should be un-enrolled in Saba \(SOU\) to be removed from a course

query: What authorizations do you need to have to be able to check if a user has an account in Moodle?
answer: System Admin access is required to be able to check if a user has an account in Moodle

query: Why doesn't 'Switch role to', within a course, seem to work properly for a course creator?
answer: (The .Switch role to. feature is intended for Learning Facilitators and Designers, so that they can see how their course appears to students)|(The .Switch role to. feature does not work for a course creator)

query: What are the ways of accessing Moodle?
answer: (Learners internal to Shell should only access Moodle through SOU by clicking on the green launch button in SOU)|(Professional users \(facilitators\) should always access Moodle through their professional account by directly logging into Moodle)|(Shift workers and learners external to Shell should access Moodle directly)

query: How can I get an overview of the results of a test or assignment as a facilitator?
answer: A facilitator can use the Teacher Grade View on the grades area \(go to Administrator block and click Grades\) to get an overview of his tests and assignments

query: How can I get an overview of my results of a test or assignment as a learner?
answer: A learner can use the 'grade' view in the left side of the screen from the course home page to get an overview of his tests and assignments

query: My student completed only one activity out of 5, but his course total shows 100%. How do I show a more progressive course total?
answer: (By default only non-empty grades are aggregated)|(The grate aggregation setting can be changed by turning on 'Editing' in the grader report)

query: What are the recommended course formats in Moodle?
answer: The recommended course formats are Topics, Weekly and OneTopic

query: How do I change the summary description in a section of a course?
answer: You can edit the summary text and graphics for a section of the course by using the text editor

query: How can I back up a course or course environment?
answer: (Moodle provides a backup tool to create archives of your courses)|(Backups can also be used to copy course resources and activities from one course to another)

query: How do I import course elements from one course to another?
answer: Course activities and resources may be imported from any other course that the facilitator has editing permissions in

query: How do I use groups with participants in a course?
answer: To utilize the group mode, you first need to create the student groups.

query: How do I find my course?
answer: (The courses list is populated automatically and is ordered by enrolment date)|(Sometimes the course list gets shortened and a link to more courses is shown at the bottom of the page)

query: What do I do with the 'Legacy files' option in the course?
answer: (Any new files to be added into a Moodle course should not go into legacy files)|(New files should be added by uploading a file into the site, or creating an alias to an existing file on the server)

query: How do set up Outcome items for my course?
answer: Course outcomes are like competencies for use in grading instead of standard grade scores

query: What type of images should I use in a course?
answer: When uploading pictures you can use different formats including PNG, JPG and GIF formats

query: How should I resize images?
answer: (Images should be resized before uploading into Moodle)|(Images can resized with free services like http://www\.picresize\.com)

query: How should I upload images into a course?
answer: Image can be inserted into a page or label by using the text editor in Moodle

query: How can I re-use a file that I have already uploaded to Moodle?
answer: A user can re-use a file that is already in Moodle by either copying or linking to the existing file

query: How are files managed in Moodle?
answer: (Files are uploaded in connection with a Resource \(e\.g\. File, Page\) or an Activity \(e\.g\. Forum, Assignment\))|(There is no central course file area)

query: What is the File Picker?
answer: (The File Picker allows files to be selected and displayed in Resources or Activities)|(With the File Picker, the file is copied into Moodle from wherever you have chosen it from, e\.g\. your computer or USB drive)

query: How do I add a file to the Moodle course?
answer: File can be added as a resource with the file picker

query: How do I copy an existing file in Moodle?
answer: An existing file can be added to a course by copying (it)|(the file) from its current location in a different course using the File Picker

query: How do I link to a file in another course?
answer: Files can be added to a course by creating an alias to it from its current location in a different course to the new location in the course where it needs to be added

query: How do I embed animations within text?
answer: The text editor can be used to embed animation files, images or media into a body of text

query: How do I use Kaltura video resources in Moodle?
answer: (A Kaltura video can be added as a resource to a course page)|(A Kaltura video can also be embedded into a body of text, using the text editor)

query: What notifications does Moodle send to users?
answer: (A user can customize in their profile what they want to get email notifications for)|(Email notifications are either 'on' or 'off')

query: Why is a user not receiving notifications or why is the user receiving unwanted automated email notifications of forum posts or submitted assignments?
answer: Email notifications are automatically sent in a number of activities including forums and assignments

query: How do I make a quiz in Moodle?
answer: A Quiz in Moodle is created by adding an activity to a course page and configuring the questions in the question bank

query: How do I create multiple choice questions?
answer: Multiple Choice Question \(MCQ\) can be created either directly in a Quiz or using the course Question bank

query: What types of feedback is available in a Quiz?
answer: Moodle 2 offers a full new quiz engine, which has a lot more granular control on showing and hiding information

query: It is possible to remove the correct answer in the feedback text?
answer: It is possible to remove the correct answer from feedback in Quiz questions

query: How do I remove the correct answer from the question feedback?
answer: To remove some of the elements in the quiz feedback page, open the 'Review options' section and uncheck all four checkboxes for 'Right Answer'

query: How do I make announcements to participants?
answer: You can make a general announcement or send a reminder to all students within a course by adding a news item to the course news forum

query: How do I enable activity completion in the course?
answer: To enable Course completion there are three areas to check: Course Settings, Completion Settings and the actual Activity settings

query: What is Blended Learning?
answer: Blended learning is an integrated strategy for delivering on promises about learning and performance

query: What is HRSD?
answer: HRSD is short for HR Service Desk

query: What is Moodle?
answer: Moodle is a course management system \(CMS\); (Moodle)|(it) is a free, open source software package designed using sound pedagogical principles, to help educators create effective online learning communities

query: What is D&D?
answer: D&D is short for Design & Development

query: What is a LMS?

answer: SOU is short for Shell Open University ?- the platform for learning and development for the entire Shell Group

query: What is an LCMS?
answer: A Learning Content Management System or LCMS is a multi-user environment where learning developers may create, store, reuse, manage, and deliver digital learning content, primarily e-learning, from a central object repository and deliver digital learning content  from a central object repository

query: What is a Standard Request?
answer: A Standard Request covers recurring requests that are always handled in the same way by the Support Organization
